title: GE Unveils AI Smart Refrigerator with Instacart and Inventory Tech
description: GE unveiled the Profile Smart 4-Door French-Door Refrigerator with a built-in barcode scanner, cameras, and Instacart integration for automated inventory tracking, shopping lists, and one-tap ordering. Priced at $3,500, it uses AI to predict needs and reduce waste. This innovation positions GE as a leader in efficient, connected kitchen tech.

title: Cop Transforms Into Frog According To AI Generated Police Report
description: An AI police report tool turned a cop into a “frog,” exposing how generative AI in policing can warp reality.

title: Pickle Unveils AI AR Glasses: Soul Computer with Memory Bubbles
description: California startup Pickle has launched the Pickle 1 AR glasses, dubbed a "soul computer," featuring AI that observes, remembers, and anticipates users' needs via "memory bubbles" for personalized assistance. Priced at $799 with a Q2 2026 release, it raises privacy concerns amid excitement for proactive AI wearables. This innovation could redefine human-machine symbiosis.

title: Plaud has unveiled a new AI wearable that I’m seriously considering replacing Otter.ai with
description: Plaud.ai Follow ZDNET: Add us as a preferred source on Google. ZDNET’s key takeaways Plaud.ai launches its latest AI wearable, the Plaud NotePin S. Plaud Desktop, a desktop app, was also launched at CES. Now users can get summaries in person and online. Since the explosion of generative AI, AI wearables have become increasingly popular, [...]

title: AI startups push 72-hour weeks, reviving China’s ‘996’ culture to stay ahead
